comment: Great professor! you will get called on, but its thought provoking, and theres no work! Just talking and thinking!

One of a kind, unique professor. Lectures are quite interesting and he challenges you to think. Only reason I didn't get an A was because I missed the second half of the semester, and participation is graded.

Great professor! He comes from industry with lots of real experiences but he's also a good teacher.

The class is mostly discussion driven. Even if you aren't typically good at that, it's very well done and there are plenty of opportunities for everyone to participate. I learned way more than in any "lecture heavy" course.

Participation matters in this class. If you do not like to be called on about what you read about in certain cases, avoid the professor. Otherwise, he's cool and knowledgable. I'd go as far to say this is one of those classes you really take something with you after you leave. I usually don't enjoy those "get called on" classes, but I did with him

Do yourself a favor and take this professor. He is so engaging and makes lectures so enjoyable. One of my absolute favorite professors I have ever taken. Make sure to actually read the cases and don't be afraid to participate because your grade rests on this. Would take him a million times again.

Professor Wermert is a fantastic choice for 4199 if you can attend classes. Currently, most of your grade will come from in-class discussions and participation, with two take-home tests. He will call you out in class for participation, and you better read the weekly cases required for the course. He is a hilarious professor, and you will enjoy it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Two discussion posts are due every week and two take home exams. This class is mainly focused on reading the cases. Make sure to do the discussion post a lot and write the papers very well. Its really hard to get that A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: Professor Wermert is a great professor to take for 4199. You don't have to read a textbook, but you are given case studies to read almost every class. They are actually fun to read. Grade to based on 50% class discussion participation and 50% take home essay exams (only 2). He makes everything relatable to the real world! Take him!

Experienced professional who actually knows what hes talking about. His goal is to make you think, and the class is separated into 25% first half participation, 25% second half participation, 25% midterm, 25% final. He likes to cut up with students and tries to make the class as unique and helpful as possible. Loved the classes I took with him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Don't take this class, attendance is mandatory and he makes you read bunch of useless case studies that have up to 20 pages. There are only a midterm and a final which is you debriefing a case. Miss class a lot? Good luck on passing. Lectures are just him talking about the cases and things he did in the past
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Class is based around participation in discussion. Very passionate professor who cares much more about learning than silly assignments. 2 exams and attendance make up the overall grade. Really nice guy who wants to teach and build friendships with students.

Very easy class that comes down to participating in class. If you want an A you must be ready to speak each class to earn your grade. $60 case set for the semester, and you must read one case before each class. Come ready to discuss, and take what you learn and apply it to the take home case study tests and you should be fine!
Professor Wermert is a great teacher. He cares about his students and wants them to do well, however, 50% of your grade is speaking in class so if you don't speak up in class it will be tough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Incredibly effective teacher. Read the cases and do some speaking and youll get an A. Love this guy. Interesting cases too. Fun class.

Read the cases and speak in class and it will be one of the best classes youll take at coles. Very interesting case material. Fun and good prep. Thinking, not typical bs multiple choice stuff, matters.
Case Study and Discussion. Best teacher I have had in Biz school.

50% participation, 25% Mid Term, 25% Midterm. Makes you think outside the box. Is involved with his students and wants to see you strive to your furthest. Really Great Prof! One of the Best in the Coles College! Would take again! Midterm and Final are case studies that he gives you weeks to work on. Just show up, be engaged and you will pass.

Easiest class ever, took him in the summer and as long as you attend class and are prepared you'll get an A since participation is 50%.  I felt he was annoyed with me an he still gave me and A because I was prepared for class. Easy take home assignments, with answers on Course hero.  If you don't do well its solely your fault for slacking....
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Graded on two things: participation and 2 take-home case studies. He's not consistent in his grading; he tends to grade based on how much he likes you. He likes to hear himself talk and asks questions that make no sense. Don't let him intimidate you with his confusing questions. Most of the time everyone else is confused too.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Wermert grades his students on two things, case study and class participation. He does not take attendance by it's important to be in class because participation counts for half the grades. The other half is based on two exams, midterm and final which are case studies. No homework or quiz the entire semester. Case studies only and lecture
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Engaging and honestly pretty fun class. No extra credit but be sure you read the cases in preparation for class . Be clear and concise in what you put in the case studies and you'll do fine.  50/50 split between participation and 2 case studies. Didn't try very hard and received a B.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Overall he is the best professor in the Management department. 50 % of your grade is based on participation and 50% is based on a take-home case study exam. He is a more lenient based on how much he likes you and he tends to prefer international/ foreign students for his class discussion.

You read a case study before class & then have a class discussion on it. 50% of your grade is participation & the other 50% is based on a take home case study midterm & final. I almost didn't take the class bc this intimated me but I'm so glad I did. Wermert is the best! Just make an effort to talk to him & he will like u & it will help your grade
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: I found that he will grade based off of how he likes you. Half of your grade is participation, so if you skip class don't take him because you will fail. Getting a B is doable in this class. I worked so hard to try to make an A, spoke every day in class and worked hard on the case studies and came out with a B. He offends though so be careful
A truly solid professor with a really immersive style. Doesn't throw BS your way. He will help you to think objectively on complex issues.
Best professor in the Coles College of Business!!!

PARTICIPATE. Class participation is not optional and he will call on you. He is great at teaching the subjects and you will enjoy the class. Everything is based of of cases that you read before hand.  There are two tests, a take home midterm and take home final both based off of cases.
One of the best teachers I have ever had! Class discussions every day with no notes! 2 take home exams in bullet format and class participation is the only other grade! best of all no text book!
Great professor! Very interesting class. Take him! No textbook!
Great professor! Go to class, read the cases, participate!  Take him! No textbook!

This is a great professor who is more real world then most. He is a firm believer in case studies not text books. Class discussions are always interesting. 2 take home essays and a sim along with participation is your grade. NO GROUP ACTIVITY!!!!!! He does not grade easy but he does grade fair. I have taken every class he teaches he is that good.

Hilarious and entertaining guy. But honestly grading is so confusing. Says participation is 50 percent of grade (must be in class to participate). I had a friend who skipped often and still got an A. I was there everyday and participated often and got a B. Both of us did the same on exams. Confused!

His class is pure case studies and learning specific parts of IHR.  Mostly you learn about a subject than analyze a case based on what you just learned. Most applicable business class I've ever taken with scenarios based on things we will encounter in the business environment. Makes you think.
He is the BEST professor! Attendance is not mandatory, however 50% of your grade revolves around class participation. The material is interesting! Take him!! I got an A!

Take him for MGT 4199. Really cool guy . Fair grader.  you have 2 cases to write. super easy  and then is CAPSIM project . CAPSIM = ANNOYING . Apart form CAPSIM, I loved the class. If you take him , you will not regret it .

He is a great professor. One of my most fav out of my whole time at ksu. this guy is very smart and he has a lot of knowledge. he just wants you to participate. read the stupid articles and give input ur Guaranteed at least a B. also he is a big Giants fan so spend a couple mins talking sports. Highly recommended!!!!
Best professor at KSU. Very smart guy with a lot to offer students. Wish I took him for more classes before this one.

One of the best at KSU. He is going to treat you like a business professional. If you cannot be responsible and act like an adult, you will not enjoy his class. Tremendous professor preparing students for the real world. Honest effort will earn you an A or B.

Professor Wermert is a very good professor. He expects you show up to class and participate. I almost did not take his class this summer semester, 2011 because of the negative ratings. Please do not believe everything that you read. Professor Wermert is one of the best professors I had at KSU. Do what is expected of you and you will pass the class.

400 PTS and 50% is participation. It seems so easy but yet how do keep up with participation when 1 person can talk once in a semester and get a 90 when somebody else does the best they can and get 70 or 80. This grade is not really based on effort but it is based on whether he likes you or not from the beginning. the material is off the chart then

Very little workload. 2 written 4-page case analyses (unless you have an A going into the second, then just 1). Half your grade is attendance/participation and is hard to earn! The entire class everyone's basically scrambling to prove merely that they read the boring case. Not much discussion about the actual SIGNIFICANCE of the cases. Hewilloffend

As far as work load in the class goes, there is no stress 400 pts, 50% goes to participation therefore you must be in class to get those points. Well this is an easy B class because it is hard to know how he bases his participation grade because you might end up having the same grade with someone who never talks in class. GET ON HIS GOOD SIDE!

Arrogant to the Nth degree! His class is run like a zoo! And, as far as participation being a large part of your grade - that's an understatement! It's 50% of your grade! Prof. Wermert's style is to create a hostile and belligerent classroom environment. It can get extremely cutthroat!  Students are sometimes disrespentful to him also. So sad!

Wermert is one of the best professors I had at KSU. He expects you to show up to class and participate (a decent portion of your grade depends on it). The faster he knows your name (for good reasons) the better. Do the assigned reading and midterm, don't sleep during class, feign interest in the subjects and you'll get a B. Best MGT 4199 Professor!

I agree with previous post!  Don't take this class with this professor!  Professor is a "male chauvinist pig"!  He belittles his students, especially the ones who either aren't doing well or aren't his pet favorites.  He does a poor job of letting you know what he expects of you in order for you to succeed - very vague!  DO NOT TAKE HIM!  BEWARE!

This class is BS!  I'm currently enrolled.  Just received grade for 1st 1/2 of semester's participation and was shocked at how low my score was!  Anyone who knows me from other classes knows I get involved in class discussions.  But in this class you have to be a whinny, immature, disrespectful brat to get a good grade!!!  Accounting majors beware!

He is super funny. He knows everyone's names from the first week, and will definitely pick on you if he thinks you haven't read the material. Know current events, read the cases and participate in class. Make sure you have a good group! Grade is made up of midterm (essay), final group prject and participation. GREAT teacher!

Wermert is awesome! The format of his class is so different. Make sure you go to class, read the cases and say SOMETHING every discussion day. Work on the project early, you can turn it in ahead of time for feedback (which you will probably get a LOT of). I definitely recommend him!

He is a great professor! I took for both mgt 4174 and 4190. He really knows his stuff and won't bore you to death. Both classes similar in format except the learning materials. Read all case studies assigned and attend class everyday and no doubt you will do well. MGT 4174's project was intense but our group nailed it and we made an A.

By far one of the greatest teachers at Kennesaw. I took him for 4199 and 4190 and learned a lot, plus I got an A in both. You do have to attend class and read the cases considering half your grade is participation but he is willing to help in any way. He is a very smart man and both classes were interesting! One paper and one group project for each

One of my favorite professors in my entire college experience.  He lectures one day a week and the other you have a case study that is discussed in class.  Grades depend on a midterm paper (takehome case study), a group project, and class participation.  He knows everyone's name and will call on you randomly.  Great prof, I'm taking him again!

Awesome teacher! Attendance is not mandatory, but half of your grade is participation. No test, one paper (mid-term), and one project. You need to read the cases and talk a lot. Get started on the project early, it is a lot of work. But again the teacher is awesome, I would highly recommend him to anyone.

He is an amazing prof. he challenges you to think. DO NOT (and i repeat) DO NOT wait to do the project or not take it seriously. it is much harder than it first seems. Participate in class, it can save you. i had a 89.2 before the participation (which is 150/400 points) and got full credit for participation and bumped me up considerably.

The best professor I've had. One take home midterm (case) and a group project. Participation is a huge part of your grade and he remembers every student by name. You will enjoy his class. He keeps you motivated and interested in the course.
Great teacher! Your graded on a take home midterm, a group project and class participation. Easy you just have to do the work. He is a great mentor and keeps you interested

Jim is an excellent professor!  His class is taught from experience, although he does use the book alot.  The two exams are essays, with the final being a take home.  Over all this class is fairly easy and I would recommend taking it.
great teacher! this is the 2nd class i had with him...group project kinda boring and participation is a must but overall great teacher tests are either take home or open note and book.

Jim is the man! He knows his stuff, and he's very willing to help you in and outside of the classroom. This was by far, the most interesting class I have ever taken at KSU and the one where I learned a lot of valuable "real- life" concepts. I would reccomend him anyday, plus he's very easy on the eyes.
Class is relatively easy -- take it in the summer to avoid the simulation. Wermert is very interested in the subject, and a very good teacher. I'd recommend him for everyone.
Wowww.  Take him in the summer.  Great teacher.  Just talk a lot and say smart things.  If he knows you know you will make an A.
great professor but it somewhat boring because he goes off on a lot of tangents. overall its an easy course because the test are all take home essays

Very cool guy. Laid back, has about 16 quizzes which are pretty easy and are online and open book with all the content coming solely from the chapter. He does like to pick on people but never puts you down and appreciates whatever input you have. Overall this guy is highly recommended and I'd take any of his classes offered. No exams!

Takes the time to get to know his students.  Good prof but dry lectures.  Huge group project and presentation.  2 test, both take home and more so of a case study.  Don’t have to take the final if you get a B or higher in the class.

If you need an A, without busy work take him........great professor, very knowledgeable. only two tests, one essay very easy and the final short answers. weekly quizes with unlimited chances to get 100%. Group project is very laid back.

AWESOME PROF! Real business guy with real business knowledge. Loves teaching and loves to be involved. He will offer more guidance and support than most. Just wants you to learn. Tests are about thinking and NOT memorizing. WONDERFUL asset to KSU!

Wermert is AWESOME!  Pretty new at the professor thing but business knowledge is unbelievable!  This guy is the best asset in the school and cool as can be to boot.  Best you can ask for and KSU better keep a tight grip on this guy.
